title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: OPTIMAL NUTRITION PRACTICES& SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2024, key target populations (adolescent girls, and pregnant & lactating women and children <59 months and care givers) in 6 high priority provinces benefit from the use of optimal nutrition practices and services.

mailing-address.narrative: Boulevard. du 30 Juin No. 87 Building de la Communauté Hellenique Commune de la Gombe B.P. 7248 Kinshasa

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, key target populations (adolescent girls, and pregnant & lactating women and children <59 months and care givers) in 6 high priority provinces benefit from the use of optimal nutrition practices and services.
